I’ve been into barefoot and zero drop shoes for a while now. I love the fit and feel of my other pairs but I hate these. My largest complaint is the pad and heel grips are jarring and noticeable after walking for even small stretches of time. And wearing them for even longer amounts of time will make your heel and toe pads sore. These two sections of the shoe protrude out further than the rest of the sole and actually hurt until worn down. Another complaint I have is how warm these shoes get. Now if you wear them in colder temps it’s not too noticeable but in the summer they are hard to keep on. The warmth has to be due to how insulated and unbreathable the fabric is. Again if you like warmer footwear this isn’t too much of a problem. But if you sweat in your feet at all or swell when warm you will notice it big time. With that being stated these shoes fit tight and hug your foot well, that would be a plus if they were any type of breathable. If your feet swell from heat and moisture there’s nowhere for your feet to stretch out to and they become even more uncomfortable. Since these shoes are don’t allow for air circulation if your shoes have a tendency to have odor these will most definitely get one. This isn’t a huge deal with most shoes as cleaning them is typically not too hard, but these shoes don’t have a removable insoles and are hard to wash. They are machine washable so I found flipping them inside out and air drying them the same way was the best option. But I had to rinse and repeat a few times to really get them clean. The quality is all over the place, I found the adhesive holding the sole to the sock part of the shoe to be middle of the road as they began to peel after a few months of wear. If I had to give these shoes any praises it’s on how they look, I really enjoyed the way they looked on my feet especially with baggier pants. Loved the silhouette and will be looking for a similar style from a different brand. Thanks for reading! Hope I gave some feedback that helped you in deciding if these were for you.

How cool to have lightweight shoe/socks to stroll around the house. The right one easily slid on but when it came to the left foot, NO go. The heavy duty material the socks are made of do not stretch enough to go around this fat ankle. It seems like a great idea.

评论概述: Comfy casual shoes, but definitely go up a size
评论详情: I wear women's USA size 7 comfortably in any shoe, including several brands of minimalist wide-toe-box zero-drop walking shoes I've bought on Amazon. But based on some reviews for this product I decided to go up a size and get the 8, which is the smallest size shown in the drop-down chart. Glad I did, because they fit like my usual 7's. I have wide feet, and they don't cramp my toes. They're comfortable when I do my daily long walks and my feet stay put and don't move around in them when I wear lightweight bamboo crew socks. I got the dark blue ones, like the look!

They're honestly pretty stiff, hard to put on, and don't bend naturally with your foot, it feels more like a regular shoe with a thin sole. I don't recommend if you have wide feet, as they feel tight, even if you go a size up. If you do want to try these out, stretch them out before wearing them.

I have been using these to hike and jog around our property and I like them! I have also worn them to run errands in town.  So far, nothing about them has bothered me. I like the fit; it was accurate to the size chart, even with one of my feet being a bit larger than the other.  As far as durability goes, I've walked across gravel, mud, sticks, grass, rocks, and pretty much anything in these. They've done fine. (I'm not sure if it would protect you from a large thorn, but then, some shoes don't, either.)  The only thing I haven't tried yet is a water crossing OR washing these. We'll have to see how they hold up under complete soaking!  Definitely would be a great option for hiking through water and "camp shoes."

These are my very first pair of barefoot shoes and I have to say that they are extremely comfortable and my feet feel very in-touch with the ground and like the muscles are actually activating. For the price, these are great and I don't see a reason not to go for it on the price if you're on the fence on whether to get them. I have 2 issues with these that prevent me from loving these, however.  My first issue is that the toe box is a bit tight and gets uncomfortable after long periods of wearing. I feel it cramming my toes and the way it pushes around inside of them causes pain if I wear them longer than an hour.  My second issue is that these get very, very warm after intermediate periods of wearing them. If I wear socks with them (which I recommend), my socks feel drenched from sweat due to the tight fit with lack of any ventilation. These aren't thin like a sock, they feel more like a canvas you'd feel from a pair of Vans or something of the likeness.
